page.title: 02St Peter and St Paul
page.content: The building of the church was begun in the 15th century by John De Vere,13th Earl of Oxford,whose star and heraldic shields are on the porch.Thomas Spryng and other wool merchants gave money to help with the building.The tower which is 57 metres high was built first and stood alone for many years.Its 8 bells are famous in the ringing world.The church is built in the perpendicular style and the original building has not been altered.The oldest thing inside is the 14th century font,which is believed to have stood outside for several years The window in the tower won a prize at the International Exhibition in 1862. The chapel is now mostly organ,behind it is the American corner.The American Airforce donated the old organ pump. When Thomas Spryng died,his wife had a carved parclose built in his memory. The church is a well-known landmark.
